summary: New Guinea is the second-largest island on Earth, located in the Pacific Ocean near Australia. It covers an area of 785,753 square kilometers. The island is divided between two countries: Papua New Guinea in the east and Indonesia in the west. This division occurred due to historical and geographical reasons. The name "New Guinea" was given by a Spanish explorer who noticed similarities between the island's indigenous people and those from Africa's Guinea region. The island is home to two main cities, Port Moresby and Jayapura.
title: New Guinea
